I saw my HPB Dr. and he adjusted my meds and everything was back to normal, in days. I was in agony and needed treatment ASAP.  I called the Oral Surgeon's office and was still put off for at least 2 weeks. I called Dr. Kamelchuk's office the same day and his staff got me in immediately knowing my obvious discomfort. My DDS sent a referral and I was quickly treated, my pain gone, cured. Dr. Kamelchuk's staff of professionals are the most compassionate, caring, dedicated, cordial, health care folks I have ever had the pleasure to know. Their dedication to medicine and the easing of the concerns of a patient and patient's family are painstakingly put to rest by reassurance. I have been in the Medical/Dental profession for over 40+ years and find this Dr. and staff to be exceptional. My personal thanks to you all.

Upon reviewing my x-rays he quickly observed a new area of concern, which had not been brought to my attention by the referring physicians, and to their credit, it may not have been noticeable on other visits. However, Dr. Nazam reassured me that he would take care of everything. He and his dental/surgical team all have great bedside manners,. They equally helped to put me at ease with their warm, funny and engaging dialogue. Lastly, Dr. Sami personally contacted me the evenings of each procedure, I was pleasantly shocked and excited to have my him call to inquire how I was doing as the pain was intense. He explained what he saw during the procedures, what was done to resolve the issues, what to expect over the next few days, and how to address any concerns I may further encounter.  Wow!!!  His follow-up actions spoke volumes to me, VOLUMES...! 🙏🏽👏🏽🙏🏽   Thank you for making me feel like a part of your family. Awesome, awesome job Dr. Nazam, and the Alabama Surgical Arts staff. 😀😀😀

The bleeding stopped within a few hours and I was able to enjoy some soup later on. My face is a bit puffy, but not as much as I thought I'd swell. The night after my surgery, Dr. Nizam called to check in on me to make sure I was alright. I have stitches in my mouth, but they're not bothersome. He really is an amazing surgeon. Everything took less than an hour. I highly recommend going to Alabama Surgical Arts. Overall, positive experience and they helped me overcome my dentophobia. name: Narrae Allen
text:
Husband was sent here to have all of his wisdom teeth removed at once to avoid infection. The office is very nice, VERY efficient (we were in an out within an hour), and the Dr. himself seems attentive, and even called to check in on us that evening. My problem is with the post-op info - or lack thereof - from the nurse who helped my husband to the car.

She handed me a single sheet that mostly covered medication schedules and dietary restrictions, a pack of gauze, and 4 prescriptions. I have no knowledge of how to care for oral postop things, but my mom's a nurse so i know these things can go smoothly or horribly depending on the patient's choices after surgery - behavior that is usually informed by the advise of medical staff, since the general populace is presumably ignorant (safest assumption). I asked if I needed to replace the gauze as soon as we got home, and was about to ask what all he needed to avoid doing. The nurse quickly said, cordially but also sharply such that she cut me off before i could ask, "everything you need to know is written on this sheet" and told me to call if I had questions. Well, long story short he ended up using a straw and doing a few other things I had no idea he wasn't supposed to, because i didn't //know// those were things i needed to ask about, and the sheet made no mention of any of them. I am now unsure how much of his pain is a natural consequence, and how much is our fault. So now we're keeping an eye on, questioning every symptom, which is stressful for both of us. I acknowledge our fault herein but really feel that this all could have been avoided had we been more informed  about restrictions at discharge

resp.text: I am truthfully sorry you feel you were not given explicit instructions. We try to explain every step of the procedure in detail. I personally call every patient to ask if there are any questions the night of surgery. My personal cell phone is on your post op instructions as well. If you have any questions feel free to call me 24 hours a day. I can be available tomorrow morning if you would like me to take a look. The recommended pain control strategies with maximum dosages are listed on the post op instructions sheet if needed. Hope all is well.  -Dr. Nizam

name: Kerri Krilla
text: For over 20 years I suffered from periodontal disease and was a patient of a well respected Periodontal specialist in Philadelphia. During that time, the intent was to keep my teeth and gums as healthy as possible. Regularly scheduled deep cleaning worked. However, my doctor retired and the new staff had different ideas. The regularly scheduled deep cleaning was no longer an option, and within a couple of years my teeth deteriorated to the point where it was embarrassing to even smile. The new staff recommended extractions, at first only a few teeth. Ultimately, they planned to extract all my teeth and do implants. I agreed to have the first three teeth extracted. That was the beginning of a horrible time for me. After the extractions I bled profusely and was in a lot of pain. For two weeks I continued to bleed on and off. I was frightened ,I could not eat, and I was miserable. As time passed it didn't get much better, and I was not myself, as I was normally very outgoing and talkative, but now became very uncomfortable around people. The staff then recommended extracting the rest of my teeth and doing implants. But I was afraid of what might happen after the last experience. I thought, "if I bled so profusely from 3 extractions, how would my body react to all my teeth being extracted". The thoughts going through my head were all scary and uncertain. I sought out other opinions, but did not have a good feeling with anyone. Finally, in late 2016, I met with Dr. Sam Nizam. When we met, I immediately felt the connection, and I was comfortable. Dr. Sam listened to all my concerns attentively. I knew the qualities in a doctor that I was looking for and Dr. Sam had all of them. Dr. Sam sat me down and explained step by step what he recommended and how the procedures would be done. He was so calm and confident, and did not sugar coat anything. He explained that I needed 26 extractions, and why. He explained that I needed bone grafting for the implants to take, where he would need to do the grafting, and why. He explained that I needed a sinus lift, and where and why. Also, he showed me visually on the computer and pointed out exactly where my implants would be placed, to have the best chance of success. He explained how all procedures would be done at the same time. I was still nervous about the whole process, but I had total confidence in Dr. Sam and agreed to schedule it as soon as possible. It was February, 2018. I was in surgery for 5 1/2 hours. He performed all the work that he had explained to me. I went home, knowing I was in good hands and that I was going to be fine. But I was just a little nervous, thinking I might bleed. Dr. Sam prescribed pain killers, which I took that night and went to sleep. I awoke after a peaceful night sleep. My bleeding was the size of a dime!. I had minimal pain. I stopped taking the pain killers. I went back for a follow up. Dr. Sam was pleased with the results and so was I. No pain, no bleeding, the implants (all 11 of them) all took. I now have new teeth. I can smile again. I can speak without fear and embarrassment. At my daughter's wedding I was able to proudly smile and laugh all night! Dr. Sam gave me my life back! I am myself again! Thank you!! I will always be grateful to Dr. Sam for the incredible work he did, that now gives me the chance to enjoy life as I had not been able to do for so long. If I ever have a problem, even though I now live many states away in New Jersey, I would not hesitate to make the trip. I recommend Dr. Sam highly . He has been blessed with a tremendous talent and gift to help people. I wish him all the best,and pray that his success helps thousands more like me in the future. - Linda K

I hated the fact that I felt it, being I had a very bad experience from another dental clinic. so I was somewhat scared. but I thought, since I won't feel anything... would I go back? yes!.. because everyone were so nice, but this time I would say, could you triple the dose of the last time!

name: Jennifer Holzner
text:
DO NOT GO HERE

My boyfriend had work done here upon the recommendation of my dentist (whom I love) When we arrived they seemed very confused as to which teeth they were supposed to be pulling. I asked if they should call the dentist to double check and they said no, by looking at the x-rays it was pretty common sense as to what needed to be done. The procedure was quick, but that is not saying much considering the entire office was clearly in a rush which made more sense after the receptionist informed me they were trying to leave at noon that day. I got my boyfriend home and about an hour later he went to remove his gauze and noticed they had FORGOTTEN TO REMOVE TWO OF HIS TEETH. We had to go back and thankfully we had about 20 min to spare before they closed. Not once did they say out loud they forgot anything, they just quietly whisked him back and seemed to want to keep everything hush hush (again, trying to leave early). They never even apologized to us for the MAJOR inconvenience of having to be put out again, to have another surgery after the one he had an hour ago.

After 2 months of waiting, any time I called to inquire about our bill or to get a break down everyone was extremely rude. Transferring me without stating what they were doing, getting an attitude over the phone. Not to mention I never once EVER got a call back from a voicemail I left, I always had to call back the next morning.

Anyways, this place sucks. They seem fancy and like a well oiled machine but you are not their priority, believe me. Full of crotchety old ladies who pass the buck.
